norepinephrine.name: Norepinephrine
norepinephrine.notes: Prefer central line; titrate to MAP.
guided_steps: Confirm indication and baseline vitals.
Select available ampoule strength (4 mg or 8 mg).
Choose dilution volume (50 ml recommended for titration).
Calculate infusion and program pump (mL/hr).
Ask second nurse to verify the prepared infusion.

epinephrine.name: Epinephrine
guided_steps: Confirm indication and cardiac rhythm.
Prefer central access for high concentrations.
Titrate carefully and monitor heart rate.

dopamine.name: Dopamine
guided_steps: Check indication and monitor arrhythmias.
Use recommended dilution to avoid extremely high concentration.
Titrate slowly while monitoring perfusion.

dobutamine.name: Dobutamine
dobutamine.notes: Use for inotropic support; watch for tachycardia.
guided_steps: Confirm indication: inotropy required.
Choose dilution (common: 250 mg in 250 ml).
Set pump and monitor HR/BP.

nitroglycerin.name: Nitroglycerin (TNG)
nitroglycerin.notes: Protect from light; watch for hypotension.
guided_steps: Select available ampoule strength (5 mg preferred).
Choose dilution: 50 ml syringe recommended for titration.
Enter target in mcg/min; monitor BP closely.

labetalol.name: Labetalol

vials.note: 200 mg (concentrated) - dilute as per local practice

guided_steps: Confirm no contraindication (e.g., asthma, severe bradycardia).
Choose dilution and calculate infusion rate.
Monitor HR and BP frequently after start.

amiodarone.name: Amiodarone

vials.note: 450 mg vial (may be diluted into 250 ml)

amiodarone.notes: Use inline filter; protect from light when required.
guided_steps: Confirm indication and loading dose history.
Choose dilution (250 ml common for maintenance infusion).
Monitor QT and liver function long term.

insulin_regular.name: Insulin (Regular)
insulin_regular.notes: Follow hypoglycemia protocol and bedside glucose monitoring.
guided_steps: Confirm blood glucose and indication for infusion.
Choose vial strength and dilution (50 ml common).
Set pump = units/hr ÷ units/ml; check bedside glucose hourly.
Prepare hypoglycemia rescue (D50) available at bedside.

heparin.name: Heparin
heparin.notes: Follow local protocols for bolus + infusion; monitor aPTT/anti-Xa.
guided_steps: Confirm bolus given if required by protocol.
Choose dilution and calculate pump rate.
Document and arrange lab monitoring.

furosemide.name: Furosemide (Lasix)

vials.note: 50 mg in 2 ml (IV bolus) - infusion preparation varies

guided_steps: Confirm indication and urine output baseline.
Select dilution; monitor electrolytes and renal function.
Adjust rate based on response.

magnesium.name: Magnesium Sulfate
magnesium.notes: Monitor deep tendon reflexes and respirations with boluses.
guided_steps: Confirm indication (e.g., torsades prophylaxis, eclampsia).
Choose dilution and calculate infusion rate.
Monitor reflexes and respiratory status.

nicardipine.name: Nicardipine
guided_steps: Confirm indication and baseline BP.
Choose dilution and calculate pump setting.
Observe BP and adjust per protocol.
